conclusion: Analyze the circuit in two states: switch open and switch closed.
Circuit consists of resistance R1 and ammeter in series with voltage source U.
Motor M is not part of the active circuit as the switch to it is open.
Reading of the ammeter is I0 = 0.5A.
Resistance R1 = 20Ω.
Using Ohm's Law, voltage across the circuit U = I0 × R1 = 10V.
Voltage across the circuit remains unchanged when the switch is closed, U = 10V.
Resistor R1 is in parallel with the electric motor M when the switch is closed.
Total current from the source I is the sum of current through R1 (I1) and current through the motor (IM).
Current through R1 is I1 = U/R1 = 0.5A.
Motor's internal resistance is R2 = 10Ω.
Motor acts as a non-pure resistive component; part of electrical energy is converted into mechanical energy.
For a DC motor, effective resistance is lower than static resistance when rotating.
Power consumed by the entire circuit when switch is closed is total power delivered by voltage source.
Maximum current through motor if it were just a resistor is IM,max = U/R2 = 1.0A.
Since motor is rotating, IM < 1.0A.
Total current when switch is closed is Itotal = I1 + IM.
Itotal = 0.5A + IM.
Since IM < 1.0A, Itotal < 1.5A.
Power consumed by circuit is P = U × Itotal.
P = 10V × Itotal.
Since Itotal < 1.5A, P < 15W.
Final answer is P < 15W.
